original_solution_mapping.L1: First find the total area of the forest: 4 miles * 6 miles = <<4*6=24>>24 square miles
original_solution_mapping.L2: Then find the total number of trees in that area: 600 trees/square mile * 24 square miles = <<600*24=14400>>14400 trees
original_solution_mapping.L3: Then find the number of trees all the loggers can cut down in one day: 8 loggers * 6 trees/logger = <<8*6=48>>48 trees
original_solution_mapping.L4: Then divide the total number of trees by the number cut down per day to find the number of days it takes to clear the forest: 14400 trees / 48 trees/day = <<14400/48=300>>300 days
original_solution_mapping.L5: Then divide the time in days by the number of days per month to find the time in months: 300 days / 30 days/month = <<300/30=10>>10 months

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4396.
    Returns: the number of months it will take to cut down all trees.
    """
    # L1
    forest_length = 4 # 4 miles
    forest_width = 6 # 6 miles
    total_area = forest_length * forest_width

    # L2
    trees_per_square_mile = 600 # each square mile has 600 trees
    total_trees = trees_per_square_mile * total_area

    # L3
    num_loggers = 8 # 8 loggers
    trees_per_logger_per_day = 6 # 6 trees per day
    trees_cut_per_day_by_all_loggers = num_loggers * trees_per_logger_per_day

    # L4
    days_to_clear_forest = total_trees / trees_cut_per_day_by_all_loggers

    # L5
    days_per_month = 30 # 30 days in each month
    months_to_clear_forest = days_to_clear_forest / days_per_month

    # FA
    answer = months_to_clear_forest
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: First find the total area of the forest: {forest_length} miles * {forest_width} miles = <<{forest_length}*{forest_width}={total_area}>>{total_area} square miles
Then find the total number of trees in that area: {trees_per_square_mile} trees/square mile * {total_area} square miles = <<{trees_per_square_mile}*{total_area}={total_trees}>>{total_trees} trees

Then find the number of trees all the loggers can cut down in one day: {num_loggers} loggers * {trees_per_logger_per_day} trees/logger = <<{num_loggers}*{trees_per_logger_per_day}={trees_cut_per_day_by_all_loggers}>>{trees_cut_per_day_by_all_loggers} trees

Then divide the total number of trees by the number cut down per day to find the number of days it takes to clear the forest: {total_trees} trees / {trees_cut_per_day_by_all_loggers} trees/day = <<{total_trees}/{trees_cut_per_day_by_all_loggers}={days_to_clear_forest}>>{days_to_clear_forest} days

Then divide the time in days by the number of days per month to find the time in months: {days_to_clear_forest} days / {days_per_month} days/month = <<{days_to_clear_forest}/{days_per_month}={months_to_clear_forest}>>{months_to_clear_forest} months
